com.gdxgame.core.model

Class AnimatedGameObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gdxgame.core.model.GameObject
      • com.gdxgame.core.model.AnimatedGameObject

  • public abstract class AnimatedGameObject
extends GameObject
    AnimatedGameObject is one of the core classes for game objects. It is used to define a link between a game object and an AnimatedSprite. Similar to the AnimatedSprite class it contains functionality to move around a frame for any texture. The information of the AnimatedGameObject's frame can then be used to set the correct frame index for the AnimatedSprite. Additionally it contains functionality to fadeout/-in game objects over a specified time. AnimatedGameObject should always be linked with an AnimatedSprite. Otherwise use the GameObject class instead. check GameUtils.renderGameObject method to see how the AnimatedGameObject and AnimatedSprite are linked before rendering

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(float deltaTime)
        Updates the animation and transparency of an animated game object. This will change the current frame index to the next whenever the currentAnimationTime is greater than the animationTime;
        Specified by:
        update in class GameObject
        Parameters:
        deltaTime - time passed since last frame

      • setAnimationPerSecond

        public void setAnimationPerSecond(int animationsPerSecond)
        sets new amount of animations to be displayed per second
        Parameters:
        animationsPerSecond - number of animations displayed per second

      • setTextureType

        public void setTextureType(TextureType textureType)
        sets new texture type for the animated game object. this will update the number of animations per row and number of animations per column of the animated game object.
        Parameters:
        textureType - new type of texture for animated game object

      • setAnimation

        public void setAnimation(int animation)
        sets frame to the given animation. The first animation has index 0 while the last animation has index ((animations per row * animations per column) - 1).
        Parameters:
        animation - index of animation to be set

      • setLoopAnimations

        public void setLoopAnimations(int startAnimation,
                              int endAnimation)
        sets start and end index of animations that should be displayed. If your sprite f.e. has 5 animations and you only want to display animation 1 to 3 then you can use this method. StartAnimation parameter would be 0 and endAnimation 2. A call to this method automatically unpauses the animation.
        Parameters:
        startAnimation - animation index to start
        endAnimation - animation index to end

      • startAnimation

        public void startAnimation()
        starts the animation from the current frame

      • stopAnimation

        public void stopAnimation()
        stops the animation at the current frame

      • loopAnimation

        public void loopAnimation(boolean loop)
        defines if an animation should loop or not. If it does not loop then the animation will stop at the last animation index
        Parameters:
        loop - true to start an animation loop. false to stop the animation at the end at the last animation index.

      • getFrameIndexX

        public int getFrameIndexX()
        returns current animation frame index x of the animated game object
        Returns:
        frame index x

      • getTransparency

        public float getTransparency()
        returns current transparency of the animated game object
        Returns:
        transparency of animated game object

      • setTransparency

        public void setTransparency(float transparency)
        sets transparency of the animated game object. A value of 1 means that the animated game object will be invisible. A value of 0 means fully opaque.
        Parameters:
        transparency - new transparency value. Must be between 0 and 1

      • fadeTo

        public void fadeTo(float targetTransparency,
                   float time)
        changes animated game object's transparency to the given targetTransparency within a certain time.
        Parameters:
        targetTransparency - target transparency of animated game object
        time - time in seconds until animated game object reaches target transparency

      • flip

        public void flip(boolean flipX,
                 boolean flipY)
        flip animation by its x-axis and/or y-axis
        Parameters:
        flipX - true to flip animation by its x-axis.false otherwise
        flipY - true to flip animation by its y-axis.false otherwise

      • isFlipX

        public boolean isFlipX()
        returns if animated game object is flipped by its x-axis
        Returns:
        true if animated game object is flipped by its x-axis. false otherwise.

      • isFlipY

        public boolean isFlipY()
        returns if animated game object is flipped by its y-axis
        Returns:
        true if animated game object is flipped by its y-axis. false otherwise.

      • setColor

        public void setColor(float red,
                     float green,
                     float blue)
        sets the color of the game object. default is red=1,green=1 and blue=1. Color value can be between 0.0 and 1.0.
        Parameters:

        green - green color tone
